result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan D. Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With any other probation now serving

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Must maintain current full-time employment and must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  You shall have no contact with any of the victims, including the cases that were dismissed and read-in: 15CF154, 15CF155, 15CF187, and 15CF188.  May have contact with the victims if they agree and they have appropriately notified the Department of Corrections through the proper channels and it has been approved by your agent.  You must comply with any other no contact orders issued by your probation agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent including AODA.  You must comply with all recommended programming and/or treatment and successfully complete as well.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  You must submit a DNA sample to the Jackson County Jail and pay the surcharge.  You must comply with any other recommendations of your probation agent.  Defendant must submit to random PBT's by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  Defendant must submit to random urinalysis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  You must identify each victim in all cases, including the read-ins and write a letter to each of them.  That letter is to include how you now understand what you did and how it impacted the victim; how you feel about it and what you can do to make them feel better.  You must give all the letters to your agent to review.  It is at your agents discretion if the letters should be sent to the victims.

timeConds.notes:
Must report on or before June 17, 2016 by 6:00 p.m.  May serve on EMP according to jail rules if arrangements can be made.  Credit for 15 days served.
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case 15CF156

Amended 6/20/18:  Jail credit of 417 days granted.
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 15CF111 and 15CF156.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment needs.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

Sentencing hearing on revocation 1-18-18
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No changes or corrections. Victim notification has been complied with.  

Joint recommendation for:  Case #15CF111:  18 months Wisconsin State Prison followed by two years extended supervision concurrent with 15CF156 and 15CF160. CC.  
Case #15CF156. Count 1: 2 years Wisconsin State Prison followed by three years extended supervision concurrent with 15CF111 and 15CF160. $4,398.43 restitution and court costs.  Pay restitution from prison funds and while on ES.  
Case #15CF160. Count 1: 2 years Wisconsin State Prison followed by three years extended supervision concurrent with 15CF156 and 15CF111.  
Case #15CF160, Count 2:  30 days jails concurrent  with 15CF156 and 15CF111.  CC.  
156, 160.  414 days credit.  15CF111- 129 days credit.  Eligible for CIP and SAP.  
Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  

Court ordered:  Case #15CF111: 3 1/2 years bifurcated as 18 months Wisconsin State Prison followed by 2 years extended supervision. CC.  
Case #15CF156. Count 1: 5 years bifurcated as 2 years Wisconsin State Prison followed by 3 years extended supervision concurrent with 15CF111 and 15CF160. $4,398.43  restitution and court costs.  Pay from prison wages.  
Case #15CF160. Count 1: 5 years bifurcated as 2 years Wisconsin State Prison followed by 3 years extended supervision concurrent with 15CF156 and 15CF111.  
Case #15CF160, Count 2:  30 days jails concurrent  with Count 1 (find time served) and 15CF156 and 15CF111.  CC.  
15CF156 and 15CF160.  414 days credit.  15CF111- 129 days credit.  
ES conditions:    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.  Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment needs.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Pay restitution on a regular monthly basis.  CC.  

Eligible for CIP and SAP.
SEHR rescheduled at request of PD's Office; no atty available in a.m.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From NA sponsor
Email from SPD William Poss to ADA Inlow

Defendant appears in person with counsel SPD William Poss.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  DA Fox states they have complied with victim notification on all cases.  The victim in 15CF187 is present in the courtroom.  Defendant will plead to charges and waive the preliminary hearing on the following cases:  15CF111,15CF156, and 15CF160.  Court performs colloquy with defendant regarding right to preliminary hearing on those cases.  Court finds the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and voluntarily waives his right to the preliminary hearing in those cases.  Bound over for trial on each of those cases.  State files the Information for those 3 cases.  15CF111 - Court reviews the charges/penalties/elements of Count 1 with the defendant.  He enters a plea of guilty to Count 1.  15CF160 - Court reviews the charges/penalties/elements of Counts 1 & 2 with defendant.  He enters a plea of Guilty to Counts 1 & 2.  15CF156 - Court reviews the charge/penalties/elements of Count 1 with the defendant.  He pleads guilty to Count 1.  Court performs colloquy of plea questionnaire/waiver of rights with defendant.  Felony warning given.  Defense stipulates to the factual basis in each complaint.  Court finds he understands the proceedings and his pleas of guilty/waiver of rights are made freely, voluntarily and intelligently and finds him guilty of the charges plead to.  The following are dismissed and read-in:  Count 2 in 15CF156, Count 2 in 15CF111, and cases 15CF187, 15CF188, 15CF154, and 15CF155.  The victim in 15CF187 is present but does not wish to make a statement to the Court.  There is a joint recommendation for sentencing to withhold sentence and place on probation for 5 years concurrent on all counts with conditions.  The Court  states that probation cannot be 5 years on the misdemeanor charge in 15CF156.  DA recites the conditions recommended:  On 15CF156 & 15CF160 to serve 120 days jail;  must maintain employment; no contact with any othe victims unless approved by DOC; to pay restitution; must have a risk and needs assessment and comply with all recommendations of agent.  Attorney Poss states he believes there is jail credit and requests EMP for employment purposes.  Defendant exercises his right to allocution.  The Court reads all the victim impact statements that were filed in all cases.  Court adopts the joint recommendation with some changes and orders sentence is withheld and places on probation for 5 years on all felony counts and 1 year probation on misdemeanor count, all concurrent.  Conditions of probation are:  On 15CF156 & 15CF160 to serve 270 days jail concurrent.  May be served on EMP.  Jail term to commence on or before 6-17-16 at 6:00 p.m.  No contact with any of the victims in all cases including the dismissed and read-in cases/counts unless they agree and notify agent appropriately.  Must comply with any other no contact orders of agent.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant must submit to random urinalysis by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  Defendant must submit to random PBT's by probation agent or any law enforcement officer.  Must maintain current employment.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant is to identify each victim in all cases including the cases that were dismissed and read-in and write a letter to each victim.  Each letter must include the following:  How the defendant now understands what he did and how it impacted them; how he feels about it and what he can do to make them feel better.  Must give letters to probationa agent to review and it's up to the agent if they should be sent to the victims.  Restitution ordered in: 15CF187 - $1185.00; 15CF155 -  $71.44; 15CF188 - $430.00; 15CF154 & 15CF156 - $750.00 & $2000.00.  Must set up a payment plan with agent to re-pay all restitution during the term of probation.  Must pay all costs, submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharges.  Court instructs counsel to come to an agreement for the jail credit and to let the Clerk fo Court know that amount.  They agreed on 15 days jail credit after court per attorney William Poss.

Plea/sentencing hearing on June 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on June 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
